key_points: Dwyane Wade spoke about spending time with Tiger Woods for a Golf Digest and GOLFTV content shoot at Rolling Hills Country Club in Los Angeles County a day before Woods' car accident.
Actor David Spade also joined the video shoot where Woods gave golf lessons to celebrities.
Hours after Wade teased his lesson with Woods on Instagram, Woods was involved in a serious car accident.
The accident took place near Rolling Hills Estates and Rancho Palos Verdes, causing major damage to Woods' vehicle.
Woods was hospitalized and underwent surgery for significant orthopedic injuries at Harbor-UCLA Medical Center.
Wade, a retired three-time NBA champion, expressed how Woods inspired him and many in the Black community to take up golf.
Wade shared his shock and well-wishes for Woods, hoping for a speedy recovery.
Woods' team issued a statement saying he had "significant orthopedic injuries" and had undergone emergency surgery.
The surgery involved stabilizing fractures in Woods' tibia and fibular bones, as well as injuries to his foot and ankle.
Woods was reported to be "awake, responsive, and recovering in his hospital room."
spokespersons: Anish Mahajan, MD (Chief Medical Officer, Harbor-UCLA Medical Center)
